title: How to Hack a Hand Cranked Flashlight for Emergency Power

steps.headline: Take apart the flashlight with care.
steps.description:
Inside you will find a small hand-cranked generator and some button cells that generate power. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/af\/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/af\/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Obtain a 12 volt car adapter.
steps.description:
Ensure that it fits the item that you want to charge (for example, a cell phone). Cut the end off, leaving the end that plugs into the phone or other appliance. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/85\/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/85\/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Solder the wires of the 12 volt adapter to the two button cell contacts.
Cut a notch in the plastic of the flashlight to fit the cable.
Put the connector in and see if it will charge your cell phone or other appliance.
steps.description:
Crank the flashlight. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Look for the charging symbols on your phone.
steps.description: Try other appliances, such as a PDA.

text:
Take apart the flashlight with care. Inside you will find a small hand-cranked generator and some button cells that generate power. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Obtain a 12 volt car adapter. Ensure that it fits the item that you want to charge (for example, a cell phone). Cut the end off, leaving the end that plugs into the phone or other appliance. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Check the polarity. Solder the wires of the 12 volt adapter to the two button cell contacts. See Warnings. Cut a notch in the plastic of the flashlight to fit the cable. Seal up the flashlight. Put the connector in and see if it will charge your cell phone or other appliance. Crank the flashlight. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Hack-a-Hand-Cranked-Flashlight-for-Emergency-Power-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Look for the charging symbols on your phone. Try other appliances, such as a PDA.
